channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: World Elder Abuse Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, 15 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day

World Elder Abuse Awareness Day was launched on June 15, 2006 by the International Network for the Prevention of Elder Abuse and the World Health Organization at the United Nations. WEAAD also supports the United Nations International Plan of Action that acknowledges the significance of elder abuse a as a public health and human rights issue.
World Elder Abuse Awareness Day provides an opportunity for communities around the world to promote a better understanding of abuse and neglect of older persons by raising awareness of the cultural, social, economic and demographic processes affecting elder abuse and neglect.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services and UnitingCare

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services and UnitingCare

item.title: NCWQ Celebrating 120 Years
item.description:
Monday, 16 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to celebrate 120 Years of NCWQ 

The National Council of Women of Queensland (NCWQ) is an umbrella organisation for thirty women’s organisations. We seek to raise awareness of the rights and responsibilities of members as citizens and encourages their participation in all aspects of community life.
The 120th Anniversary celebration is to acknowledge significant difference NCWQ has made with a theme of Celebrating Queensland Women’s Voices; the legacy, leadership and change. NCWQ was started on 15th June 1905.

This Light Up is organised by: The National Council of Women of QLD (NCWQ)

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
item.x-trumba:customfield: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: National Police Legacy Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 17 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support National Police Legacy Day

This year, on 17 June, we proudly mark a new tradition: the very first National Police Legacy Day.
For 54 years, Police Legacy organisations across Australia have provided support to police and their families. Through both heartbreak and healing. Now, we come together nationally to honour this legacy of care. It is also a day to recognise all those who serve in our police forces — and the families who uphold their memory with strength and pride.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Police Legacy Scheme

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

It is also a day to recognise all those who serve in our police forces — and the families who uphold their memory with strength and pride.
This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Police Legacy Scheme

item.title: State of Origin - Game II Perth
item.description:
Wednesday, 18 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to support State of Origin - Game II Perth

Perth’s Optus Stadium will host the much-anticipated State of Origin Game II between the New South Wales 'Blues' and Queensland 'Maroons' on Wednesday, 18 June 2025.
State of Origin is one of Australian sport’s greatest rivalries where Queensland is looking for redemption in this years series.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Sickle Cell Day
item.description:
Thursday, 19 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support World Sickle Cell Day

World Sickle Cell Day, which takes place on June 19 each year, is an internationally recognised awareness day promoting equitable access to treatment of those living with sickle cell anaemia and to break down stigma in the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell Australia

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

World Sickle Cell Day, which takes place on June 19 each year, is an internationally recognised awareness day promoting equitable access to treatment of those living with sickle cell anaemia and to break down stigma in the community.
This Light Up is organised by: Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: YRNA Fun Run
item.description:
Friday, 20 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support YRNA Fun Run

You Are Not Alone is a youth mental health charity dedicated to shining a light on youth mental health, through engagement with schools and community events. The annual YRNA Fun Run aims to shine a light on youth mental health and raise funds for awareness events in our local community. Our main goal is to empower young people to speak up and remind them they are not alone.

This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone Australia Limited

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
item.xCal:description:
Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support YRNA Fun Run
You Are Not Alone is a youth mental health charity dedicated to shining a light on youth mental health, through engagement with schools and community events. The annual YRNA Fun Run aims to shine a light on youth mental health and raise funds for awareness events in our local community. Our main goal is to empower young people to speak up and remind them they are not alone.
This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone Australia Limited

Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support YRNA Fun Run
You Are Not Alone is a youth mental health charity dedicated to shining a light on youth mental health, through engagement with schools and community events. The annual YRNA Fun Run aims to shine a light on youth mental health and raise funds for awareness events in our local community. Our main goal is to empower young people to speak up and remind them they are not alone.
This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone Australia Limited

item.title: MND Global Awareness Day
item.description:
Saturday, 21 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support MND Global Awareness Day

Each year on 21 June the MND Queensland joins with the wider MND community around the world to mark Global MND Awareness Day – a day to honour everyone affected by motor neurone disease. This year, we’re shining a light on the hidden realities of living with MND

This Light Up is organised by: MND Queensland

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Show Your Stripes Day
item.description:
Sunday, 22 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Multi Coloured to support Show Your Stripes Day

#ShowYourStripes Day is a global event drawing attention to the changing climate, using the Climate Stripes graphics developed in 2017 and seen around the world: showyourstripes.info…

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Conservation Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Conservation Council

item.title: Olympic Day
item.description:
Monday, 23 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Olympic Colours to celebrate Olympic Day

Olympic Day is celebrated all around the world on 23 June, in global celebration of the founding of the International Olympic Committee and the modern Olympic Movement in 1894.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
item.description:
Wednesday, 25 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
 

Migraine Australia is celebrating Migraine Awareness Month again this June with our ‘Give Migraine a Break’ campaign.
We start the month with ‘Burple Day’ on Friday June 6 where we ask everyone to dress in burgundy or purple for awareness of migraine.
Shades for Migraine is on Saturday June 21, an international day for migraine, we ask everyone to wear sunglasses, take a selfie and post it to socials, in support of people with migraine.

Migraine Australia is the only national patient advocacy organisation to support all Australians, through advocacy, information and support, led by people living with Migraine. We work to actively and demonstrably improve the quality of life and wellbeing of all Australians living with Migraine and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia



Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
